description: From Pashto سنګر‎ (sangar) or from Persian سنگر‎ (sangar).

entries.meaning: (military, UK) A stone breastwork; a fortified niche or look-out post.
examples: At the summits of these the enemy sharpshooters waited for them in sangars, or rock-built entrenchments, each of which had to be taken before the advance could safely continue.
